content.description: Highball. Start with left facing holds and go op and over the bulge to the right of Banana Split (V0). if you get sketched out higher up you can move into the Huecos on Banana Split. A variation called "Splitting Headache" starts in the scoop corner just to the right and works up and left into this route, and also goes at V1
content.location: On the left side of Split Boulder (as viewed from the road) on the side facing the facing the road. Climb the bulge to the right of Banana Split.

content.description:
Obvious 20' hand crack that separates the boulder on the west side of Split Boulder.  Slightly leaning start but perfect 2" hands to the top.   

  Flat landing, no obstructions.
content.location: West face of Split Boulder facing the road

content.description: Begin sitting down under the boulder that forms the base stone to the route Divine Wind. Climb out left around the corner to a horizontal crack-line. Traverse the crack-line to the top.   Down-climb and drop to descend.
content.protection: Crash pad or two nothing major.
content.location: This small cave is located between the main wall and the base boulder (left) of All the Nasty's.

content.description: Highball on the left side of Split Boulder. Climb the steps to a small corner.
content.location: Furthest left on the side of Split Boulder that faces the road. Some obvious huecos, and to the left of the bulge.

content.description: Begin sitting under the boulder on furthest back section of the crack. Climb the crack out around the corner and top out straight up or by following the rail.Â
A super fun problem that goes up the middle of the east face on excellent holds.
content.location: Middle of the east face (side that faces the cliff) of Split Boulder.

content.description:
Malice Boulder provides 3 main problems all facing N or N/W.   

  Split Boulder the larger of the two can be found 30' to the south of Malice boulder directly below the Central Wall and provides at least 20 problems ranging from V0- to V4.  Split boulder has problems on all aspects of 20 foot boulder providing year round shade/sun.
